articles.description: Richarlison scores but cannot prevent Tottenham going out of the EFL Cup as Fulham win a penalty shootout to progress to round three.
articles.title: Richarlison scores but Fulham beat Spurs in shootout

articles.description: League Two Salford stun Championship side Leeds with an epic penalty shootout victory in the Carabao Cup.
articles.title: Salford pull off shock with penalty win over Leeds

articles.description: Katie Boulter reaches the US Open second round for the first time as she begins an action-packed day for the British players with an impressive win.
articles.title: 'Time to push on' - Boulter earns first US Open win

articles.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland wins the PFA Player of the Year award, while Arsenal forward Bukayo Saka is named Young Player of the Year.
articles.title: Man City's Haaland wins PFA men's Player of the Year

articles.description: England's Ella Toone says Luis Rubiales ''should do the right thing'' and resign after he kissed Spanish player Jenni Hermoso on the lips after the World Cup final.
articles.title: Rubiales situation too far gone for apology - Toone

articles.description: Aston Villa striker Rachel Daly wins the PFA Women's Player of the Year award, while Chelsea star Lauren James is named Young Player of the Year.
articles.title: Daly wins PFA Women's Player of the Year award

articles.description: The Spanish Football Federation is exploring its options over whether it can sack Women's World Cup-winning head coach Jorge Vilda.
articles.title: Spanish FA exploring options to sack Vilda

articles.description: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores a hat-trick as Crystal Palace come from 2-0 down to win 4-2 at Plymouth Argyle in the Carabao Cup.
articles.title: Mateta inspires Palace comeback win at Plymouth

articles.description: The UK government launches a new initiative with the target of getting an additional 3.5 million people physically active by 2030.
articles.title: Government plans to get extra 3.5m active by 2030

articles.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers boss Gary O'Neil expects midfielder Matheus Nunes to still be at the club after Friday's transfer deadline day.
articles.title: O'Neil expects Nunes to stay at Wolves
